snippet: The sanctions, first passed in 2006, ban the shipment of conventional arms into and out of Iran and appeared to have been resolved months ago.
abstract: News Analysis; one of last major sticking points in nuclear negotiations with Iran is sanctions passed by United Nations Security Council that ban import and export of conventional arms, which include ballistic missile technology.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: The sanctions, first passed in 2006, ban the shipment of conventional arms into and out of Iran and appeared to have been resolved months ago.

headline.print_headline: A Final Hurdle in Iran Talks Deals With Conventional, Not Nuclear, Arms
headline.main: A Final Hurdle in Iran Talks Deals With Conventional, Not Nuclear, Arms

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
